comments.body: shall we call `QueryExecution.prepareExecutedPlan`? For non-AQE DPP, we will plan the DPP subquery in the rule `PlanSubqueries`, which calls `prepareExecutedPlan`

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +77,81 @@          // plan optimization rules be inserted twice, once in AQE framework and
          // another in prepareExecutedPlan() method.
          val sparkPlan = QueryExecution.createSparkPlan(session, planner, aggregate)
          val newAdaptivePlan = adaptivePlan.copy(inputPlan = sparkPlan)
          val values = SubqueryExec(name, newAdaptivePlan)

comments.body: Seems we don't need this config. It's always beneficial to do so. The AQE + DPP integration is only in master and not released yet, so we don't need to worry about regressions.
Thank you for your time. Yes, we may keep it now for reviewing and remove it finally.
